abstract.p: Joseph G Dunn letter disputes Anthony Walton's April 23 article on film, Settin' the Woods on Fire

block.p: After reading Anthony Walton's article about ''Settin' the Woods on Fire'' [''In Making Myths, Betraying Our Past,'' April 23], I felt compelled to respond. I believe Mr. Walton missed the entire point of the film. The story of George Wallace is a record of a man who craved power more then anything else, and if his pursuit of power made him defend the poor blacks and whites of Alabama as a judge, or vilify and persecute the black population of Alabama as governor, than that is exactly what he would do. Power was his aim, not hatred.

After reading Anthony Walton's article about ''Settin' the Woods on Fire'' [''In Making Myths, Betraying Our Past,'' April 23], I felt compelled to respond. I believe Mr. Walton missed the entire point of the film. The story of George Wallace is a record of a man who craved power more then anything else, and if his pursuit of power made him defend the poor blacks and whites of Alabama as a judge, or vilify and persecute the black population of Alabama as governor, than that is exactly what he would do. Power was his aim, not hatred.

As to Mr. Watson's claim that Mr. Wallace was ''not very good at chasing the presidency,'' in Mr. Wallace's campaigns in 1968 and 1972 he steadily rose in the polls. As a young man during this time I vividly remember the wide-reaching popularity of his conservative views, even in my hometown of New York. The fact that Mr. Watson can, with a straight face, blame a high school altercation between black and white teenagers on Wallace's views and pronouncements says a whole lot more about him and his views than Wallace's. Until he can see the truth about men like Wallace -- that the amount of power available to elected officials in this nation is so massive that it will drive people to extraordinary actions to achieve it -- he will be relegated to the mass of citizenry who will be fooled again in the future.
JOSEPH G. DUNN Fort Lauderdale, Fla.
